com.centurylink.mdw.services.process

Class BaseActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.centurylink.mdw.services.process.BaseActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActivityCategory, GeneralActivity, Category
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultActivityImpl

    public abstract class BaseActivity
extends java.lang.Object
implements GeneralActivity
    Base class that implements the Controlled Activity. All the controlled activities should extend this class.

      • setParameterValue

        protected java.lang.Long setParameterValue(java.lang.Long processInstId,
                                           java.lang.String name,
                                           java.lang.Object value)
                                    throws ActivityException
        This method is used to set the value of a variable that does not belong to the current process instance. The feature is mainly for backward compatibility and should not be used for new code. Warning: this method should *not* be used for setting variable values for the current process instance, as it does not update cached variable instance.
        Parameters:
        processInstId - process instance ID where the variable belongs.
        name - variable name
        value - variable value; the value must not be null or empty string, which will cause database not-null constraint violation
        Returns:
        variable instance ID
        Throws:
        ActivityException

      • setParameterValueAsDocument

        protected DocumentReference setParameterValueAsDocument(java.lang.String name,
                                                        java.lang.String varType,
                                                        java.lang.Object value)
                                                 throws ActivityException
        Set the value of the variable as a document reference to the given document. If the variable is already bound to a document reference, the method updates the content of the referred document. The method will throw an exception if the document reference points to a remote document.
        Parameters:
        name - name
        varType - variable type
        value - this is the document
        Throws:
        ActivityException

      • getVariableValueSmart

                                          throws PropertyException
        Throws:
        PropertyException

      • getAttributeValueSmart

        protected java.lang.String getAttributeValueSmart(java.lang.String name)
        Same as getAttributeValue() except performing translations in the following cases:
        • If the value starts with “prop:”, treat it as a property specification and return the property value. The property specification has the syntax “prop:property-group/property-name”.
        • If the value starts with a dollar sign followed by an identifier, it is treated as a variable name and the method returns the variable instance value as the result.
        • If the value starts with string:, the rest of the value is returned without interpretation. This may be needed when the literal string contains special characters that may be misinterpreted as expression.
        • If the value starts with magic:, the rest of the value is considered an expression in Magic Box language. It evaluates the expression and return the result. If it fails to evaluate, the method throws a PropertyException.
        • If the value contains { and }, and the text in between is a variable (a dollar sign followed by variable name), then the value is obtained by replacing the place holders by corresponding variable values
        • If the value looks like a Magic expression (if it contains dollar sign or colon), evaluate the expression and return the result. If it fails to evaluate, return the original value (instead of throwing an exception in the case when the value starts with magic:).
        • If none of above applies, return the value as it is.
        Parameters:
        name - name
        Returns:
        attribute value (literal or translated).
        Throws:
        PropertyException - if a translation rule is applied and translation fails.

      • getValueSmart

        protected java.lang.String getValueSmart(java.lang.String value,

        protected boolean valueIsVariable(java.lang.String v)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • createDocument

        protected DocumentReference createDocument(java.lang.String docType,
                                           java.lang.Object document,
                                           java.lang.String ownerType,
                                           java.lang.Long ownerId,
                                           java.lang.String path)
                                    throws ActivityException

      • createDocument

        protected DocumentReference createDocument(java.lang.String docType,
                                           java.lang.Object document,
                                           java.lang.String ownerType,
                                           java.lang.Long ownerId,
                                           java.lang.Integer statusCode,
                                           java.lang.String statusMessage)
                                    throws ActivityException
        Create a new document, persisted in database, and return a document reference object, to be bound to a variable.
        Parameters:
        docType - type of the document (i.e. variable type)
        document - document object itself
        ownerType - owner type. More than likely this will be OwnerType.VARIABLE_INSTANCE other possible types are LISTENER_REQUEST, LISTENER_RESPONSE, ADAPTOR_REQUEST, ADAPTOR_RESPONSE
        ownerId - ID of the owner, dependent on owner type.
        statusCode - status code
        statusMessage - message
        Returns:
        document reference
        Throws:
        ActivityException

                                           java.lang.String statusMessage,

      • openDatabaseAccess

        protected DatabaseAccess openDatabaseAccess(java.lang.String database_name)
                                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Open a database connection.
        Parameters:
        database_name - it must be null if you are accessing MDW database (the default database where MDW schemas reside). For other databases, you need to pass in either a data source name or JDBC URL.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

        protected java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String propertyName)
        Get MDW system property value (not java system property value, which can be retrieved using System.getProperty), using configured property manager. If package-specific properties are defined, then those will be used. MDW allows to supply a custom property manager in place of the out-of-box property manager, using java system property "property_manager", which takes the class name of the custom property manager as its value.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - property name
        Returns:
        value of the property, or null if the property does not exist.

                         int version)

      • executeScript

        protected java.lang.Object executeScript(java.lang.String script,
                                         java.lang.String language,
                                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> addlBindings,
                                         java.lang.String qualifier)
                                  throws ActivityException
        Executes a script, passing additional bindings to be made available to the script. Script should return a value for the result code if the default (null is not desired).
        Parameters:
        script - - the script content
        language - - built-in support for Groovy, and JavaScript (default is Groovy)
        Throws:
        ActivityException

      • getVariableValue

        protected java.lang.Object getVariableValue(java.lang.String varName)
                                     throws ActivityException
        Convenience method that returns a variable value, dereferencing doc types. Note: to update a document value it must be included in getOutputDocuments().
        Parameters:
        varName - variable name
        Returns:
        the variable value
        Throws:
        ActivityException

      • setVariableValue

        protected void setVariableValue(java.lang.String varName,
                                java.lang.Object value)
                         throws ActivityException
        Convenience method to set variable value regardless of type.
        Throws:
        ActivityException

      • setVariableValue

        protected void setVariableValue(java.lang.String varName,
                                java.lang.String varType,
                                java.lang.Object value)
                         throws ActivityException
        Convenience method that sets a variable value, including document content. Meant to be used by Script, Dynamic Java and other activities where it is not known whether the value of a document has changed after execution. Note: to update a document value through this method it must be included in getOutputDocuments().
        Parameters:
        varName - variable name
        varType - variable type
        value - new value to set
        Throws:
        ActivityException
